TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit UserDelegationEventReceiver extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Includes event handlers for methods that manage user delegations in the class.

remarks.para: Important: Methods in the UserDelegationEventReceiver class are not supported in the SharePoint Permission Mode, which is used by Project Online and a default on-premises installation of Project Server 2013. For more information, see SharePoint Permission ModeWhat's new for IT pros in Project Server 2013 article on TechNet.
For an example that uses events for user delegation, see Project Server 2010 Delegation Audit Event Handler

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void OnActivated(class Microsoft.Office.Project.Server.Library.PSContextInfo contextInfo, class Microsoft.Office.Project.Server.Events.UserDelegationActivatePostEventArgs e) cil managed
Public Overridable Sub OnActivated (contextInfo As PSContextInfo, e As UserDelegationActivatePostEventArgs)
public: virtual void OnActivated(Microsoft::Office::Project::Server::Library::PSContextInfo ^ contextInfo, Microsoft::Office::Project::Server::Events::UserDelegationActivatePostEventArgs ^ e);

abstract member OnActivated : Microsoft.Office.Project.Server.Library.PSContextInfo * Microsoft.Office.Project.Server.Events.UserDelegationActivatePostEventArgs -> unit override this.OnActivated : Microsoft.Office.Project.Server.Library.PSContextInfo * Microsoft.Office.Project.Server.Events.UserDelegationActivatePostEventArgs -> unit

Docs.param: Contains the Project Server context information.
The data for the event.
Docs.summary: A post-event handler for delegate activation.

remarks.para: Important: The OnActivated event receiver is not supported in the SharePoint Permission Mode, which is used by Project Online and a default on-premises installation of Project Server 2013. For more information, see SharePoint Permission ModeWhat's new for IT pros in Project Server 2013 article on TechNet.
or methods can set a time to start or stop a user delegation, in the UserDelegationDataSet. The activation or deactivation of a delegation occurs by an internal process at those times.
For an example that uses the OnActivated event handler, see Project Server 2010 Delegation Audit Event Handler
